function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Developing standardized daylight levels without considering disease transmission risk","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission due to inadequate building design","Mitigation":"Conducting research to understand the relationship between daylight levels and disease transmission, and incorporating disease transmission risk into building design standards","Technologies":"Building information modeling (BIM) software to simulate disease transmission in buildings","People":"Residents, building designers, architects","Owner":"Research institutions, building design organizations"},{"Description":"Neglecting the impact of low relative humidity on disease transmission","Impact":"Greater risk of disease transmission in low humidity environments","Mitigation":"Monitoring and maintaining relative humidity levels within the recommended range of 40-60% to reduce virus survival time","Technologies":"Humidity monitoring systems, HVAC systems with humidity control","People":"Building owners, facility managers, HVAC technicians","Owner":"Facility management companies, HVAC service providers"},{"Description":"Unintended adverse effects of COVID-19 containment measures on mental and physical health","Impact":"Negative impact on mental, physical, and psychological well-being of individuals","Mitigation":"Implementing support systems, access to natural views, and green spaces to mitigate the negative effects of isolation","Technologies":"Telehealth platforms, community engagement apps, urban planning software for green spaces","People":"Isolated individuals, healthcare providers, urban planners","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, local governments, urban planning departments"}]}
